verses.text: 為基督耶穌被囚禁的保羅，和提摩太弟兄，寫信給我們所愛的，又一同作工的腓利門，

words.note: Used to refer to a fellow believer.
A formal way to express 'whom we love'.

verses.heading: Salutation

verses.text: 和亞腓亞姊妹，並我們的戰友亞基布，以及在你家裡的教會。

words.note: Used to refer to a fellow believer.
Often used to connect nouns or clauses, similar to 'and' or 'also'.
Figurative use for a fellow worker in Christ.
Refers to both a local congregation and the universal body of believers.

verses.text: 願恩惠平安從我們的父 神和主耶穌基督臨到你們。

words.note: Used to express a wish or desire, often at the beginning of a blessing.
A common greeting, also carries a spiritual meaning in the Bible.
Refers to God as Father.
Often capitalized or raised character in Chinese Bibles.
Often used for spiritual blessings 'descending' upon someone.

verses.text: 我聽見你對主耶穌和眾聖徒有愛心和信心，我每逢禱告提到你的時候，就常常感謝我的 神。

words.note: 見 acts as a resultative complement indicating successful hearing.
Often prefaces groups of people, e.g., 眾人 (all people).
Refers to believers, literally 'holy disciples'.
Refers to a compassionate or loving disposition.
A core concept in Christianity.
到 acts as a resultative complement.
Indicates a consequence or immediate follow-up.
Repetition emphasizes frequency.

verses.heading: Thanks for Philemon’s Love and Faith

verses.text: 願你與眾人分享你的信心的時候，會產生功效，使我們可以知道在我們中間的一切善事，都是為基督作的。

words.note: Used to express a wish or desire, often at the beginning of a blessing.
Similar to 和 (hé) but often more formal or literary.
A core concept in Christianity.
道 can also mean 'to know' as a verb.

verses.text: 弟兄啊，眾聖徒的心既然從你得到舒暢，我也因你的愛心，得到更大的喜樂和安慰。

words.note: Used in the Bible to address fellow believers.
Refers to Christian love or benevolence.
Often used for spiritual joy.

verses.text: 我在基督裡雖然可以放膽吩咐你作應作的事，

words.note: A transliteration of 'Christos' (anointed one).

verses.heading: Paul’s Request for Onesimus

verses.text: 然而像我這上了年紀的保羅，現在又是為基督耶穌被囚禁的，寧願憑著愛心請求你，

words.note: Part of idiom '上了年紀' (advanced in age).
Refers to Christian love or benevolence.

verses.text: 就是為我在囚禁時所生的兒子歐尼西慕求你；

words.note: Combines with preceding noun to indicate 'during'.
Indicates the following verb is the result or object of an action.
Figurative here, meaning 'begotten' or 'converted'.

verses.text: 他從前對你沒有甚麼好處，但現在對你我都有好處。
我現在打發他親自回到你那裡去；他是我所心愛的。

words.note: A grammatical particle indicating passive voice or nominalizing a verb.

verses.text: 我本來想把他留在我這裡，使他在我為福音被囚禁時，可以替你服事我。

words.note: Lit. 'blessed news'
A common Christian term for service or ministry.

verses.text: 但還沒有得到你的同意，我就不願意這樣作，好叫你的善行不是出於勉強，而是出於甘心。

words.note: Often refers to moral or benevolent actions.

verses.text: 也許他暫時離開你，正是為了使你永遠得著他，

words.definition: in order to, for the sake of

words.note: Indicates successful acquisition or possession.

verses.text: 不再是奴隸，而是高過奴隸，是親愛的弟兄。對我固然是這樣，對你來說，不論按肉身或在主內的關係，更是這樣。

words.note: Used for both biological and spiritual brothers.
Often used in the construction '對...來說' (as for...)
In a theological context, refers to the human physical nature.
A common phrase in Christian context referring to a relationship with Jesus Christ.

verses.text: 所以，你要是把我看作同伴，就接納他好像接納我一樣。

words.note: Commonly used in formal contexts or religious texts.
Commonly used in formal contexts or religious texts.

verses.text: 如果他使你受了損失，或欠你甚麼，都記在我的帳上。

words.note: Traditional character for 什麽.
上 as a suffix often indicates 'on X'.

verses.text: 「我必償還」，這是我保羅親手寫的。用不著我說，甚至你的生命，你也是欠我的。

words.note: Indicates direct, personal action.

words.definition: no need to, it is unnecessary
words.note: Used to express something is not needed or worthwhile.
Here, it implies 'what you owe me'.

verses.text: 所以弟兄啊！讓我在主裡得到你的幫助，使我的心在基督裡得著暢快。

words.note: Often used to address fellow Christians in the Bible.
Refers to God or Jesus Christ.
Often combined with 在 (zài) to form 'in/inside'.
Often combined with 在 (zài) to form 'in/inside'.
Similar to 得到, emphasizes success or effect.
Describes a feeling of being at ease and joyful.

verses.text: 我深信你會聽從，也知道你所作的必超過我所說的，因此才寫信給你。

words.note: 所...的 forms a noun phrase meaning 'that which is done/made'.
所...的 forms a noun phrase meaning 'that which is said'.

verses.text: 同時，還請你為我預備住的地方，因為我盼望藉著你們的禱告，可以獲得釋放到你們那裡去。

words.note: Verb-object compound, often functions as a noun.

verses.text: 為基督耶穌的緣故和我一同坐監的以巴弗，

words.note: Lit. 'sit in prison'.

verses.heading: Concluding Greetings

verses.text: 以及我的同工馬可、亞里達古、底馬、路加都問候你。
願主耶穌基督的恩惠常與你們同在。（「與你們同在」原文作「與你們的心靈同在」；好些抄本在這書末有「阿們」一詞。）

words.note: Commonly used in Christian blessings.
A transliteration from Hebrew meaning 'so be it'.
